name: Circles Experiment based on George Nees creation
description: This artwork is inspierd by Georg Nees, one of the pioneers of computer art. The experiment explores the use of circles and grid.

name: Circles V2
description: This experiment builds upon the first by introducing a new kind of circle that draws a line after the previous is drawn.

name: Circles V3
description: The amount of lines increase with 5 lines for each circle

name: Squares Experiment
description: This experiment investigates the use of squares in a grid layout, the placement of squares is random.

name: Squares-V2
description: This experiment has more that just squares, it is all randomized and creates unique patterns each time. Try the Keys M and R

name: Squares that you can control (kind of)
Particle System
description: A cool particle system and you can press R to reset and randomize the colors

name: Particle System V2
description: A cool particle system with new features and improvements. Try dragging the mouse around.

name: Flowfield
description: This concept is based on: Daniel Shiffman, The Nature of Code

name: Flowfield V2
description: This concept is based on: Daniel Shiffman, The Nature of Code

name: Flowfield V3
description: This concept is based on: Daniel Shiffman, The Nature of Code

name: Perlin Noise Terrain
description: This code is based on The Coding Train's video about Perlin Noise Terrain.

name: Synth
description: Press one time and drag the mouse around on the canvas to create sound.

name: Synth V2
description: Press one time and drag the mouse around on the canvas to create sound.

name: Soundlines
description: A visual and auditory experiment with sound and lines.

name: Soundlines V2
description: A visual and auditory experiment with sound and lines.
